case_vignette: A 30-year-old Hispanic woman presents with her 1-year-old son, concerned that he has only small amounts of thin, wispy hair on his head and has none anywhere else on his body. She notes that he does not yet have any teeth, but has a large forehead and ears. He has been irritable and crying for the past day. She reveals a personal history of very high body temperature at times during the summer and says she customarily stays indoors with the air conditioning on, especially in the summer. On physical examination, she has sparse hair on her scalp and eyebrows, as well as eczematous patches on her bilateral lower extremities.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I'm here for my son; he has very little hair, not even on his body, no teeth yet, a big forehead and ears, and he's been fussy and crying since yesterday.
How old is your son?
My son is 1 year old.
Does your son have any known medical conditions?
No, he hasn't been diagnosed with anything.
Has he met all his developmental milestones for his age so far?
He doesn't have any teeth yet, which concerns me.
Has your pediatrician discussed any concerns about his growth or development during his check-ups?
No specific concerns were brought up during his check-ups.
Is there any family history of genetic disorders or similar symptoms in family members?
Yes, I personally have very little hair on my scalp and eyebrows, and my skin gets irritated patches on my legs.
Does your son have any patches of skin irritation or rashes?
No, he doesn't have any skin irritation or rashes.
Has your son experienced any issues with feeding or digestion?
No, he hasn't had any problems with feeding or digestion.
Considering the symptoms and family history, can you confirm if there have been any hearing or vision problems noted for your son?
There haven't been any hearing or vision problems noted for him.
**Final Diagnosis:** Hypohidrotic Ectodermal Dysplasia
